title: genes-ts: Haxe → TypeScript compiler (Genes-based)
description:
Source of truth: HAXE_TO_TYPESCRIPT_COMPILER_PLAN.md

Goal: Build a fully-featured Haxe→TypeScript compiler on Haxe 4.7 by extending Genes' JS-platform custom generator approach.

Key defaults (locked):
- TS is primary output (idiomatic TS code + project structure)
- strict TS by default (configurable)
- default runtime compatibility + opt-in minimal-runtime mode
- default .js import specifiers + opt-in extensionless imports
- Dynamic→any by default + opt-in Dynamic→unknown
- TS metadata preferred (@:ts.type/@:ts.returnType) with Genes aliases

title: M0: Compiler contract + repo layout + TS config baselines
description:
Lock the exact compiler contract before implementation.

Deliverables:
- Decide output directories (e.g. src-gen/ + dist/)
- Define names for toggles (ts.no_extension, ts.dynamic_unknown, ts.minimal_runtime, etc.)
- Recommend default tsconfig profile (NodeNext baseline) + bundler profile
- Document how users invoke the target on Haxe 4.7 (likely still via -js <out>.ts)
- Document packaging workflow (ts source + dist build)
acceptance_criteria:
- Written contract doc (or plan update) naming defaults
- One example build.hxml + tsconfig.json drafted
- Clear define/metadata surface listed
notes: Delivered M0 contract + example configs: docs/typescript-target/COMPILER_CONTRACT.md and examples/typescript-target/{build.hxml,tsconfig.node-next.json,tsconfig.bundler.json}.

title: M1: TS emitter skeleton (modules + classes + tsc green)
description:
Create the minimal TS emitter that produces valid TS per module and type-checks.

Scope:
- Emit ESM imports/exports
- Emit export class declarations (not const-class expressions)
- Handle minimal expression set for hello-world style examples
- Wire up sourcemap scaffolding (Haxe→TS)

Out of scope:
- Full expression coverage
- Enums/abstracts edge cases
acceptance_criteria:
- Generated TS passes tsc --noEmit for a small fixture
- Node runtime sanity test passes after TS->JS compilation
- Output is deterministic
close_reason:
Implemented TS emitter skeleton + runtime tweaks; 
> test:genes-ts
> node scripts/test-genes-ts.mjs

title: M2: Expression coverage parity (Genes ExprEmitter → TS)
description:
Port/adapt Genes expression emission to TS output while maintaining JS semantics.

Notes:
- Preserve cycle/extends strategy (Register.inherits)
- Preserve closure binding strategy (Register.bind)
- Ensure type-only vs value import separation does not introduce runtime cycles
acceptance_criteria:
- Existing Genes test corpus compiles (type-check)
- Runtime tests pass for representative programs
close_reason: TS full harness + JS baseline tests green

title: M3: Enums + pattern matching (runtime + TS union typing)
description:
Implement enum emission that preserves Haxe runtime semantics while producing ergonomic TS unions.

Include:
- genes.enum_discriminator support
- switch/case correctness
acceptance_criteria:
- Enum-heavy fixtures compile + run
- TS types are discriminated unions (or equivalent)
- Pattern matching behavior matches Haxe JS expectations

title: M4: Interfaces/typedefs/abstracts/generics
description:
Finish the type-surface for TS: interfaces, typedefs, generics, and abstract mapping strategy.

Include:
- Interface type/value namespace merging as needed
- Type-only import generation
- Constraint mapping (T extends ...)
acceptance_criteria:
- Generic-heavy fixtures type-check
- Interface runtime expectations met (when runtime mode enabled)
- Type graph does not reference missing types

title: M5: Externs + JS/TS interop (jsRequire/native/selfCall)
description:
Support extern-driven interop patterns and ensure import shapes are correct.

Include:
- @:jsRequire default/named/namespace
- @:native dotted paths
- @:selfCall
- extern __init__ policy
acceptance_criteria:
- Interop fixtures compile and run
- Import shapes match expectations across profiles

title: M6: DCE/type-graph correctness + packaging
description:
Solve the runtime-vs-type reachability problem and finalize distribution workflow.

Include:
- Dual graph (runtime + type) so TS signatures never reference missing exports
- Build pipeline: src-gen/ TS + dist/ JS+d.ts
- Minimal-runtime mode behavior and docs
acceptance_criteria:
- No missing-type references in TS output under -dce full
- Packaging build produces usable dist/
- Minimal-runtime profile documented and tested

title: M7: Debuggability (Haxe→TS maps + optional TS→JS composition)
description:
Improve debugging experience.

Include:
